documents.document: The ABC's @zdaniel was at today's Whitehouse briefing and Q'd Sean Spicer abt the PNG & Nauru deal, her report on RN @amworldtodaypm
@Vic_Rollison disagree; he was not clear in his answer.
The major bank CEOs will be back before parliament in early March. #auspol
Thank you for the lovely feedback the past 24 hours. Have had many colleagues helping me with a smooth start.
@chriskkenny Thank you!
Limbering up for a return to work next Monday - and we'll have a new theme for AM's 50th year! Hope you can join me.
@kyo30171 thank you Miss, onto it!
Christmas Day cruise at Ballarat. #straya https://t.co/8vrs4UnJqI
@MattDoran91 the wonderful @NickHaggarty is responsible for that.
Have a safe and Merry Christmas tweeps! See you in 2017. https://t.co/PbQno7viBu
Thank you Miss @brihonyspeed it's been awesome working along side you. I am sure you & @andrewprobyn will be a cracking good team!
@cjjosh @andrewprobyn CJ thanks! People suggest I can stay in my PJs... but I won't!
@DavisConcept @abc730 Thank you Sally, I'm looking forward to 'AM'. (And investing in a second alarm clock!)
A big hat-tip & Congrats to @andrewprobyn - he's the next political correspondent for @abc730
Congrats to @cazzmelbourne on your RBA appointment.
My holiday book & podcast list starts with ABC Podcast "Tall Tales and True" - nailing killer Bradley John Murdoch https://t.co/UnwxGSmDA9
How do you get on with Malcolm Turnbull: "if we need to speak, we speak", says @TonyAbbottMHR
Some X-benchers want to be the Centre of attention in the Senate says @TonyAbbottMHR
@Wsj6269J @dsfwalker Ah, thank you. Have asked a couple of Qs based on statement...
@Wsj6269J @dsfwalker Ok Dr J... what's "NFC"?
ATO: "Alternative work arrangements have been made for those ATO staff impacted by the outage." I have asked 'how many staff?'
IT news reports that a petabyte of data has been lost. A Petabyte is one thousand million million. (or a quadrilliâ€¦ https://t.co/0qbhuR0iGn
@dsfwalker Thank you... I had to look up a Petabyte. Yikes!
@MichaelPascoe01 Ah, Mr Pascoe.... you're right! ;)
@dsfwalker I understand it is a 'hardware' issue. But, call me skeptical,... given recent problems,..... I want to be sure.
Casual staff + contractors apparently have been told not to come in tomorrow; not sounding like ATO is confident about being online then?
ATO is still offline. How many agents/taxpayers were hoping to file before Christmas, and can't?
@valarie_austin @ProductWise @GrattanInst I had a nice flask that I used when camping. Certainly not 'male only'.
Key says he is staying in NZ, his home is in Auckland. But flags possible future board positions, possibly in Australia.
@StephenHarlamb Don't think so. Says could not stay another full term. And if he had admitted that and ran, he would have been a lame duck.
@smellytap @primroseriordan Most. Hardly any leave on their own terms. Either voters or their colleagues end their careers.
@Tim_Beshara Thank you for being understanding.... It has been a long one.
Shocking typo.. Hear.
Refreshing to here PM Key talk in frank terms .. could not look down a camera lens and say he was going to stay a full term.
PM Key going out on top... says politicians sometimes stay too long.
Well done @m_brisso enjoy your sleep-ins now, have a great break - looking forward to your work on @4corners @amworldtodaypm
@paintsandsings @mountainash04 @abc730 thank you for your lovely comments... I am moving to 'AM' from January 30.
Motion goes down 75/74. Reps on a dinner break now... back later this evening, two bits of legn to be considered.
@_SocialDemocrat @umabp Banking Royal commission.
A Senate motion on a banking royal commission is being voted on now in the Reps.
@JudithWark @abc730 @amworldtodaypm Thank you... still with them until mid December ... you can still watch! [And listen to AM!]
Here is a list of former MPs and what they've spent: https://t.co/w1e39Vc8r8 Peter Slipper eclipses all others.
Dept of Finance has released this afternoon expenditure by current and former MPs. Some of it is breath-taking.
Govt now presenting the Backpacker tax bill to Reps.
@roberthartleyf1 @JohnWren1950 No doubt, all will be revealed in MYEFO. Dec 19.
@PhilWaren @ScottMorrisonMP No-one, absolutely No one, has covered themselves in glory on this.
The Greens Deal - Backpacker rate = 15%. Super payments drop from 95 to 65%. $100m for Landcare.#auspol
@mattdasilva Yes, but the conessions???
"There is a deal"... I am told, details soon.
Greens up in 15 mins to talk about their deal on backpacker tax.
Speaker giving an update on protests yesterday.
@PaulBongiorno Thanks Bonge... I'm looking forward to it - but will miss working with @brihonyspeed -- she is a gem!
@PaulBongiorno Yes. I think my body clock is already getting in the swing... been waking at 4am a lot lately!
@AnnMareeMulders Merry Christmas! God, this place needs a big dose of you today.... I hope you and the family are well.
And have just remembered, my last QT with @abc730 ... next year, with "AM" @amworldtodaypm
@mrdlark Lordy.... I might have. Don't know how/if this is going to be fixed.
Hands up who's happy this is the last sitting day? *fingers crossed*
@MartinLow88 Ah, who's Ralph?
@renailemay @philipdalidakis @Tim_Beshara had one last night,... they're pretty good. Comfort food, I must say.
@Tim_Beshara In the old days.... (really old, in Adelaide)... I remember the tea lady and her sandwich trolley.
@Tim_Beshara Don't think so.. but good business op in the era of Uber?
Division on in the Senate on the increased security measures.
This is not about protecting parliamentarians, says Pres Parry, it's about protecting the workers who are here.
Sen Hanson says she supports the increased measures.
There will be more 2.5m fencing, 38 CCTV cameras, turnstiles at Reps and Senate to closely monitor ppl coming in.
"It's like barbed wire on the Opera House," says Sen Hinch about the increased security measures for parliament. #auspol
Govt also stressing it can't go below 15pc now, when on Sunday it was adamant it would NOT move from 19 to 15.
Backpacker tax: Labor is moving to 13pc -- BUT that still means nothing happens. This is just all politics.
Still no deal on backpacker tax. As you were......................
Backpackers Tax: govt not budging now from 15pc. Not enough to support it.... #stalemate
Nice jokes about the Gallery and snappers on the Campaign trail this year: https://t.co/2pKXXqe6ft
BShorten running through the list of Labor MPs... thanking them all for this year, noting there are more Labor people here this year.
BShorten: I recall one meeting where the PM actually asked me if there was some way we could be nicer about each other in public. 1/2
Bill Shorten says he will have to reveal a secret: between closed doors, he and the PM get on quite well.
26 Govt MPs in the chamber for the PM's valedictory. Labor MPs are filing into the chamber now, perhaps to make a point?
PM also gives @AnnMareeMulders a big shout out... for being an inspiration, an Ovarian cancer survivor.
PM says people's stories: carers, domestic violence victims ... have stayed with him. Galvanised him to rid the nation of domestic violence.
but like all good Socialists he wanted a harbourside mansion for himself paid for by the taxpayer. 2/2
PM: Mr Harbourside Mansion was surely the epithet of the campaign. Of course, Bill desperately wanted the title for himself.... 1/2
Division on over a gag motion, @SwannyQLD has taken up a spot on the frontbench.
Oppn now trying to suspend parly business, to move a motion against govt on backpacker tax.
No one has been up to walk up the grass and over the top of parliament for 11 years, says Smith. Says he is myth busting.
"The world has changed," says the Speaker when saying that some of the changes will affect the architect's original vision. #auspol
Reps back: Christmas messages about to start, the speaker talking about increased security works around parliament. (Prior to yesterday).
And @LaTrioli @mjrowland68 "The Life Project" is a fascinating read. The dedication of those behind the cohort studies is truly inspiring.
Those protestors are back, they've unfurled a banner and put dye in the pond out front.
Protesters chanting near Reps as police drag others out. https://t.co/RzKnwdLVN9
Protester getting taken out of parliament https://t.co/xaEKSApS5E
PM was frustrated at the press conference because he wasn't able to make a point on the ABCC.... now Dixers about it thwarted by protest.
Big protest in the Reps... public gallery people yelling something about Refugees.... QT brought to a stop.
"Look, over there!"................ The opposition now holding a presser on the PRRT and backpacker tax. #auspol
Cormann says if this issue is not resolved to govt's satisfaction, a rate of 32pc will apply.
Cormann says it was a "cunning ploy" by Labor and other senators got "sucked in". #auspol
Cormann has flagged that Reps will vote this down.
"The people who just got stuffed, were the farmers of Australia," says @MathiasCormann Culleton also voted with Labor.
Whoa!!! Labor's 10.5pc for the backpacker tax just got up in the Senate. Hinch sided with Labor....
The Senate is now onto debating the Govt's backpacker tax.
Michaelia Cash shaking lots of hands on the coalition side....
And Crossbenchers voting with the Govt: Hinch, Culleton, 3 x Xenophon Team, Leyonhjelm and all ON. "Hear Hear'... as govt wins vote.
ABCC bill now being voted on in the Senate....
